2 women partially buried in gravel during protest in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa

Two women in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa district were partially buried when gravel was dumped on them from a truck, while they were protesting against road construction in the area, police said on Sunday.

The women, identified as Mamta Pandey and Asha Pandey, were buried up to their necks in the pile of gravel while they were opposing the construction of a road on private land in Hinota Jorot village under Mangawa police station.

A video of the incident, which took place on Saturday, showed two women sitting behind a truck laden with gravel, which was off-loaded on them. They were later rescued by the locals and rushed to a nearby community health centre for treatment.

The women are stable and were discharged from the health centre, police said.

Based on the viral video, a case was registered. The police have seized the dumper and arrested one of the accused while the other two are still absconding.

Speaking about the incident, ADG, Law and Order, Jaideep Prasad said that it was a family matter of an alleged land dispute.

The incident also led to political outbursts, with Congress youth leader Srinivas BV lashing out at the BJP-led Madhya Pradesh government over its silence on the matter.

"This horrifying video will send chills down your spine. But the silence of the BJP Government of Madhya Pradesh, National Women Commission, Prime Minister, Home Minister, Women and Child Development Minister etc. cannot be broken," he posted on X.
